text: Hi all! For all managers around here, do you have a support group or professional network where you can tap into for how to get better at managing people (up and down)? I've recently taken on a larger team, and knowing how this slack is so helpful for content marketers - I'm wondering if anyone knows of a similar channel to ask and learn from each other? :smile:

text: <@U0153M0K2N7> <@U012GHRAHDK> at risk of sounding self promotional, I'm in the process of beta testing such a platform, though the educational focus is a little more broad (leadership, culture + storytelling). We're at the product-market validation phase right now, so I wonder if you're keen to have an offline discussion about the pain points you feel around this transition in your careers? (Also, congrats on the bigger teams!)

text: <@U017GJSQS0N> There's a good super basic course on LinkedIn Learning/Lynda.com that should help quite a bit and quickly. It might also be free through your library if you are in the US, so check there if you don't have LinkedIn premium. PR is more than just media outreach, and this will help you understand how it connects to business. There's also a PR strategic planning (or maybe it's called integrated PR) that you should check out. They're good and quick.

Hey Rachel - We’ve got a massive library of management advice at Soapbox `<https://soapboxhq.com/blog>`

Otherwise, a really great leadership-focused slack group (it is a little bit more focused on engineers but I find the advice still applies across every department) is Rands

`<https://randsinrepose.com/welcome-to-rands-leadership-slack/>`

Happy to chat!! :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
in aviation, there's a thing called "the 150-hour rule." In short, pilots are most likely to cause an accident around that mark---it's when they have _just_ enough experience to be dangerously overconfident.

what kind of "accidents" would you say content marketers (or digital marketers in general) are at risk of making at that same career stage?

text: Not spending enough time prepping for interviews. It can seem like old-hat after you've been doing it for a while, but interviewing SMEs, customers, etc. are the heart of a good story.
